text: Michael Tree (born Michael Applebaum; February 19, 1934 – March 30, 2018) was an American violist. He was born in Newark, New Jersey. He played a circa 1750 Domenicus Busan viola from Venice, Italy. Tree played on a viola made by mid 20th-century luthier Harvey Fairbanks of Binghamton, New York.Arnold Steinhardt (1998). Indivisible by Four: A String Quartet in Pursuit of Harmony, New York: Farrar, Straus and Giroux. . p132: "… [Michael] was playing on a brand-new instrument made by a relatively obscure maker, one Harvey Fairbanks from Binghamton, New York." Tree appeared as violin and viola soloist with major orchestras, including the Philadelphia, Baltimore, Los Angeles, and New Jersey. He was a founding member of the Marlboro Trio and Guarneri Quartet. Tree died in Manhattan on March 30, 2018 of Parkinson's disease at the age of 84. ==References== ==Other websites== *University of Maryland profile Category:1934 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in New York City Category:American violinists Category:Musicians from New York City Category:Musicians from Newark, New Jersey
